headline.main: Beijing Journal;For 6~, You Too Can Be a Sichuan-Style Sardine

docs.snippet: Hey, don't you know how to ride a train?" the woman on the Beijing subway yelled as she pushed past two peasants so overloaded with luggage that they were blocking the door. "Move over and make room for those of us who want to get off!"         It is
docs.lead_paragraph: Hey, don't you know how to ride a train?" the woman on the Beijing subway yelled as she pushed past two peasants so overloaded with luggage that they were blocking the door. "Move over and make room for those of us who want to get off!" It is rush hour in the Chinese capital and Beijingers, like so many surly sardines, are trying to get in and out of their frightfully overburdened subway system.

docs.snippet: A picture last Friday with an article about the Beijing subway system was published in error. It showed passengers squeezing onto a commuter train in Tokyo, not Beijing.
docs.lead_paragraph: A picture last Friday with an article about the Beijing subway system was published in error. It showed passengers squeezing onto a commuter train in Tokyo, not Beijing.
